00027  * @brief  Class for reporting results of quantification methods into an sql database
00028  */

00030 #ifndef _QUANTMETHODSQLEXPRREPORT_H_
00031 #define _QUANTMETHODSQLEXPRREPORT_H_
00032 
00033 //
00034 #include "chipstream/QuantExprMethod.h"
00035 #include "chipstream/QuantMethodReport.h"
00036 #include "chipstream/TsvReport.h"
00037 //
00038 #include "util/Util.h"
00039 //
00040 #include <cstdlib>
00041 #include <iostream>
00042 #include "sqlite3.h"
00043 
00044 //
00045 
00046 /**
00047  *   Class for reporting results of quantification methods.
00048  */
00049 class QuantMethodSqlExprReport : public QuantMethodReport {
00050 
00051 public:
00052 
00053   /**
00054    * Constructor
00055    */
00056   QuantMethodSqlExprReport(const std::string &databaseFile, const std::string &tableName, int psNameLength=30);
00057 
00058   /**
00059    * Virtual destructor for a virtual class.
00060    */
00061   virtual ~QuantMethodSqlExprReport();
00062 
00063   /** 
00064    * Get set up for a run of reporting probesets. Often used to open file
00065    * streams and print headers to files etc.
00066    * 
00067    * @param qMethod - Quantification method to be used.
00068    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00069    * 
00070    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00071    */
00072   virtual bool prepare(QuantMethod &qMethod, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00073 
00074   /** 
00075    * After every probeset computation this function is called an is an opportunity
00076    * to query the quantification method for results, residuals, etc.
00077    * 
00078    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00079    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00080    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00081    * 
00082    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00083    */
00084   virtual bool report(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00085                       QuantMethod &qMethod, 
00086                       const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00087                       std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00088                       PmAdjuster &pmAdjust);
00089 
00090   /** 
00091    * If a probeset fails to compute for whatever reason then this method is
00092    * called rather than the normal report call above. By default does nothing.
00093    * 
00094    * @param psGroup - List of probesets from which probes were used.
00095    * @param qMethod - Quantification method with compute method called.
00096    * @param layout - Where the probesets, probes, etc are on the chip.
00097    * 
00098    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00099    */
00100   virtual bool reportFailure(ProbeSetGroup &psGroup, 
00101                              QuantMethod &qMethod,
00102                              const IntensityMart &iMart, 
00103                              std::vector<ChipStream *> &iTrans, 
00104                              PmAdjuster &pmAdjust) { return true; }
00105 
00106 
00107   /** 
00108    * No more probesets will be processed, this is a chance to finish outputting
00109    * results and clean up.
00110    * 
00111    * @param qMethod - Quantification method that was used.
00112    * 
00113    * @return true if success, false otherwise.
00114    */
00115   virtual bool finish(QuantMethod &qMethod);
00116     
00117   virtual void addStdHeaders(QuantMethodReport *qReport,
00118                              const std::string& execGuid, 
00119                              const std::string& reportGuid,
00120                              const std::string& timeStr,
00121                              const std::string& commandLine,
00122                              const std::string& execVersion,
00123                              const AnalysisInfo& info);
00124 
00125   static void execute(sqlite3 *db, const std::string &sql);
00126 
00127 private:
00128 
00129   void createSummaryTable(sqlite3 *db, const std::string &tableName, const IntensityMart &iMart);
00130 
00131   void createMetaTable(sqlite3 *db, const std::string &metaTableName);
00132 
00133   /// Size of longest name
00134   int m_MaxPsNameLength;
00135   /// Database that we are writing to
00136   sqlite3 *m_Db;
00137   /// Name of the file that we're using for database.
00138   std::string m_DbFileName;
00139   /// Name of the database table that we are writing into
00140   std::string m_TableName;
00141   /// Name of the database table that contains the meta information usually found in headers
00142   std::string m_TableMetaName;
00143 
00144 };
00145 
00146 #endif /* _QUANTMETHODSQLEXPRREPORT_H_ */
